abstract: Outward calm settles on streets of Cleveland following acquittal of white Police Officer Michael Brelo in shooting deaths of unarmed black residents Timothy Russell and Malissa Williams, masking heightened racial tensions across city; city residents await verdicts in police killings of Tamir Race and Tanisha Anderson.
lead_paragraph: Seventy-one people were arrested in demonstrations on Saturday, the police said. By Sunday, the streets were quiet, but more protests were expected over police conduct and perceived racial disparities in the city.

headline.main: Cleveland Streets Are Calm, but Anger Lingers Day After Officer’s Acquittal
headline.print_headline: Cleveland Streets Are Calm, but Anger Lingers Day After Officer’s Acquittal

snippet: Seventy-one people were arrested in demonstrations on Saturday, the police said. By Sunday, the streets were quiet, but more protests were expected over police conduct and perceived racial disparities in the city.
